meanings.definition: To make a high-pitched, harsh sound
meanings.sent1: The old door screaked loudly when it opened.
meanings.sent2: The rusty swing set screaked as the children played on it.
meanings.sent3: The mouse screaked in surprise when it saw the cat.
meanings.sent4: The brakes of the car screaked in protest as the driver stopped suddenly.
meanings.sent5: The haunted house was filled with eerie sounds, including the ghostly screaking of the stairs.

meanings.sent1: Yesterday, the door screaked when I opened it.
meanings.sent2: The old floorboards screaked under his weight as he walked across the room.
meanings.sent3: The cat screaked in its sleep, dreaming of chasing mice.
meanings.sent4: The hinges of the gate screaked as it swung open slowly.
meanings.sent5: The violinist's bow screaked across the strings, creating a discordant sound.
